title: Bug: NameError Occurs When Using Sidekiq with sentry-rails Simultaneously
body:
Ruby version: 3.4.1
Rails version: 8.0.1
Sidekiq / Pro / Enterprise version(s): 7.3.8 / 7.3.2 / 7.3.2

I do not use `ActiveJob` in my Rails application. Instead, I include `Sidekiq::Job` directly:
```rb
class ApplicationJob
  include Sidekiq::Job
end
```

This change causes the `ActiveJob` constant to be defined, which should not be used in the application.
Relevant commit: [4203f28](https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/commit/4203f28b7e3468dff5742a745a42cf344830ad52)

Later, the following code in [sentry-ruby](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-ruby) causes an issue:
https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-ruby/blob/master/sentry-rails/app/jobs/sentry/send_event_job.rb#L6-L10

```rb
if defined?(::ApplicationJob) && ::ApplicationJob.ancestors.include?(::ActiveJob::Base)
  ::ApplicationJob
else
  ::ActiveJob::Base
end
```

Since `::ActiveJob::Base` does not exist, it raises a NameError in CI.

I request a revert of commit 4203f28.

```
An error occurred while loading ./spec/config/faraday_spec.rb.
Failure/Error: require_relative '../config/environment'

NameError:
  uninitialized constant ActiveJob::Base
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/sentry-rails-5.22.1/app/jobs/sentry/send_event_job.rb:6:in '<module:Sentry>'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/sentry-rails-5.22.1/app/jobs/sentry/send_event_job.rb:4:in '<top (required)>'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/bootsnap-1.18.4/lib/bootsnap/load_path_cache/core_ext/kernel_require.rb:30:in 'Kernel#require'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/zeitwerk-2.7.1/lib/zeitwerk/core_ext/kernel.rb:26:in 'Kernel#require'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/zeitwerk-2.7.1/lib/zeitwerk/cref.rb:60:in 'Module#const_get'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/zeitwerk-2.7.1/lib/zeitwerk/cref.rb:60:in 'Zeitwerk::Cref#get'

# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/zeitwerk-2.7.1/lib/zeitwerk/loader/helpers.rb:47:in 'block in Zeitwerk::Loader::Helpers#ls'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/zeitwerk-2.7.1/lib/zeitwerk/loader/helpers.rb:25:in 'Array#each'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/zeitwerk-2.7.1/lib/zeitwerk/loader/helpers.rb:25:in 'Zeitwerk::Loader::Helpers#ls'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/zeitwerk-2.7.1/lib/zeitwerk/loader/eager_load.rb:168:in 'Zeitwerk::Loader::EagerLoad#actual_eager_load_dir'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/zeitwerk-2.7.1/lib/zeitwerk/loader/eager_load.rb:17:in 'block (2 levels) in Zeitwerk::Loader::EagerLoad#eager_load'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/zeitwerk-2.7.1/lib/zeitwerk/loader/eager_load.rb:16:in 'Hash#each'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/zeitwerk-2.7.1/lib/zeitwerk/loader/eager_load.rb:16:in 'block in Zeitwerk::Loader::EagerLoad#eager_load'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/zeitwerk-2.7.1/lib/zeitwerk/loader/eager_load.rb:10:in 'Thread::Mutex#synchronize'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/zeitwerk-2.7.1/lib/zeitwerk/loader/eager_load.rb:10:in 'Zeitwerk::Loader::EagerLoad#eager_load'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/zeitwerk-2.7.1/lib/zeitwerk/loader.rb:413:in 'block in Zeitwerk::Loader.eager_load_all'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/zeitwerk-2.7.1/lib/zeitwerk/loader.rb:411:in 'Array#each'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/zeitwerk-2.7.1/lib/zeitwerk/loader.rb:411:in 'Zeitwerk::Loader.eager_load_all'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/railties-8.0.1/lib/rails/application/finisher.rb:79:in 'block in <module:Finisher>'
# ./vendor/bundle/ruby/3.4.0/gems/railties-8.0.1/lib/rails/initializable.rb:32:in 'BasicObject#instance_exec'
```
